cases.title: Oil and Natural Gas Commission vs M.B. Patel & Co.
cases.description: A civil dispute concerning breach of contract and arbitration award enforcement.
cases.facts: ONGC awarded a reconditioning contract to the contractor M.B. Patel & Co. Delays occurred due to ONGC's failure to supply materials, followed by a dispute when the contractor refused to continue work and demanded compensation. The matter was taken to arbitration, and a lumpsum award was granted to the contractor, which ONGC challenged in court.

evidence.relevance: Establishes the terms under which the dispute arose

evidence.description: Letters from ONGC requesting continuation of work
evidence.relevance: Relevant to the issue of abandonment or refusal by the contractor

evidence.description: Award dated 3-5-1985 by Umpire V.M. Patel
evidence.relevance: Central to the appeal and the basis of the judgment under scrutiny

witnesses.name: Shri A.R. Mehta
witnesses.testimony: Argued that the award was against the terms of the contract and the umpire acted beyond jurisdiction

witnesses.name: Shri V.M. Patel
witnesses.testimony: Rendered a lump-sum award without specifying breakdown per claim head

cases.title: Union of India vs Raman Iron Foundry
cases.description: A dispute over contractual breach and interim injunction concerning appropriation of payments under government supply contracts.
cases.facts: A contractual dispute arose over supply delays. The Union of India claimed damages and sought to recover them from pending payments due under other contracts. Raman Iron Foundry disputed the claim and filed for arbitration and an injunction to restrain recovery.

evidence.description: Standard Form Contract No. D.G.S. & D. 68
evidence.relevance: Defines Clause 18 and Clause 24 governing dispute resolution and recovery rights

evidence.description: Letter dated 30 March 1971 from Assistant Director of Supplies
evidence.relevance: Details ONGC’s intent to recover damages from pending bills
Restrains Union of India from recovering damages through appropriation

witnesses.name: Justice Avadh Bihari
witnesses.testimony: Ruled that Clause 18 did not permit recovery of unadjudicated claims

witnesses.name: P.N. Bhagwati
witnesses.testimony: Delivered the judgment affirming that Clause 18 applies only to admitted or adjudicated dues

cases.title: Mercator Oil and Gas Limited vs ONGC Limited and Anr
cases.description: A contractual dispute concerning invocation of bank guarantees and termination of a contract for offshore oil infrastructure conversion.
cases.facts: Mercator, part of a consortium including MOPPL and GPC, was awarded a contract by ONGC to convert the vessel 'Sagar Samrat' into a mobile offshore production unit. Due to project delays, ONGC invoked bank guarantees alleging non-performance. Mercator filed a petition under Section 9 of the Arbitration Act seeking injunction on encashment of bank guarantees, alleging fraud, undue hardship, and collusion between ONGC and GPC.

evidence.description: Original consortium contract with ONGC dated 15 December 2011
evidence.relevance: Establishes the terms of the agreement and performance obligations

evidence.description: Performance and advance payment guarantees totaling Rs. 35.875 crores
evidence.relevance: Central to the injunction sought under Section 9

evidence.description: Termination notice and invocation letters dated 25 September 2018
evidence.relevance: Basis for Mercator’s allegation of bad faith and fraud

witnesses.name: Mr. Janak Dwarkadas
witnesses.testimony: Argued that invocation was fraudulent and that project delays were excusable due to force majeure and ONGC’s own conduct

witnesses.name: Mr. Prasanna Kumar Gangisetty
witnesses.testimony: Stated that the guarantees were unconditional and invoked properly due to petitioner’s failure to meet contractual obligations
